passage_text: Comments and insights on the name Monet: | Edit. Named after my grandmother, my daughter Maria Monserrate Medina was given the nickname Monet as a baby. Monet /mon-et/ [2 sylls.] as a girls' name. Use of the last name of Impressionist painter Claude Monet. Also a brand of costume jewellery. Actress Monet Mazur.

[ 2 syll. mo-net, mon-et ] The baby girl name Monet is also used as a boy name. It is pronounced MowN EH - †. Monet is of French and Old Greek origin. It is used mainly in English and French. From French roots, its meaning is 'descendent of the protector' - in this context, Monet can be used in the English language. In addition, Monet is a form of the English, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish Monica in the French language. Forms of Monet include the English Monae, the name Monai, the name Monay, the name Monaye, the name Mone, and the name Monee. Monet is not often used as a baby girl name. It is not in the top 1000 names. Out of the family of girl names directly related to Monet, Monica was the most commonly used in 2012
